page.title: 07Acaster Selby
page.content: Ascaster Selby is a hamlet on the west bank of the river Ouse. The majority of dwellings are farms. { There is a postbox and public {telephone. Mobile shops deliver fish {weekly and bread twice weekly. The {library van calls fortnightly. Milk {is delivered to only 4 houses as many {residents are involved in dairy {farming. Parents of children aged five - eleven must arrange transport to Appleton Roebuck primary school. An eduction committee bus takes children over eleven to Tadcaster school where the 6th form takes 16-18 year olds. { Religious services are held monthly {at St John's Anglican church. There is no public bus service, most people have their own transport and are independent.
